gold_answer: on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant
results.markdown_table_response: The Board of Directors of our company is authorized to grant restricted stock unit awards or option grants to non-employee directors who have previously held the privilege of serving as directors. Non-employee directors may receive their awards or options under the same terms and conditions as other directors.
results.csv_string_response: A director receives his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant in one of two ways. If the director has been granted a restricted stock unit award in the past, then the grant is an option to the director, or the grant is exercisable immediately after the grant. If the director has been granted an option grant in the past, then the grant is an option to the director and the grant is exercisable immediately after the grant.

A non-employee director who is initially appointed after any annual meeting of stockholders will receive a restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant, up to the earlier to occur of the first anniversary of the date of grant or the next annual meeting of stockholders. No portion of an option automatically granted to a director is exercisable after the tenth anniversary after the date of option grant. Additionally, an option automatically granted to a director may be exercisable after the termination of the director’s services as described in the option agreement, generally ending three months after such termination.

results.question: What are the capital expenditures for Bell Media in 2018 and 2019?
results.markdown_table_response:
CAPITAL EXPENDITURES
BCE capital expenditures totaled $3,971 million for the year, up $17 million over 2018. This corresponded to a capital intensity ratio of 16.9%, down 0.3 pts compared to last year. Capital spending in the year reflected the following:
• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital expenditures in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to last year, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.csv_string_response:
BCE capital expenditures totaled $3,988 million for the year, up $17 million over 2018. This corresponded to a capital intensity ratio of 16.6%, down 0.3 pts compared to last year. Capital spending in the year reflected the following:
• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to last year, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

results.json_rows_response: The final answer is that the change was due to the adoption of ASC 606 in the Fiscal Year 2017. ASC 606 was a new measure for the non-recurring operating income (loss) and operating income (loss) categories, as well as an analysis for the non-recurring revenue (revenue less than the operating loss) and non-recurring revenue (revenue greater than the operating loss) segments. ASC 606 is a long-form net income statement that was released in April 2018. The original measure has been revised several times since its release and was updated by ASC 606.
